title: Have You Identified All Of Your Cyber Risk Stakeholders?
text:
Marsh
New Marsh Survey Indicates Businesses Falling Short In Managing Cyber Risk
NEW YORK , Oct. 2, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- There is a growing awareness that cyber risk needs to be addressed comprehensively across organizations, yet less than one-third of companies responding to a recent Marsh poll said they believe their key stakeholders have been identified and understand their roles.
Marsh, a global leader in insurance brokerage and risk management, asked listeners to its The New Reality of Risk Â® webcast on cybersecurity if they were confident that their organization had identified all of the key stakeholders to their cyber risk management strategy and that they understood their roles. Of the more than 250 risk professionals who responded, 31% said yes, while 69% said no or they were not sure.
The results are another red flag, signaling that many companies have yet to develop a comprehensive cyber risk management strategy. And they need to understand and clarify the roles of the key stakeholders . Companies unsure whether all of their key stakeholders have been identified - from the risk manager to the CEO to customers and suppliers - could be in for an unwanted and costly surprise.
Embracing one's role as a cyber risk stakeholder can make a difference to a business as a whole. For example, if well-trained employees flag a suspicious email that was an attempt to infiltrate the company, everyone benefits. If a facilities manager knows how to respond should an attack interfere with critical systems, everyone benefits. If a risk manager communicates the potential risks to various stakeholders, including third-party vendors, everyone benefits. And the list goes on.
To hear more about cyber risk management, listen to a replay of Marsh's New Reality of Risk webcast or visit Marsh's dedicated cyber web page on www.marsh.com .
